page.title: 06IN GRANDMA'S TIME
page.content: In the old hall there was a stage. Now it has gone. They had prayers every day which were in the old hall and the Head Girl, Evelyn Mace, sat on the balcony. At break, Grandma said, they could buy milk and biscuits in the cookery room, which was in Room 12. Grandma was one of about 200 pupils who went to the school. Now there are roughly 950 girls. Grandma's uiniform was a blue tie, white blouse, gym slip (which was knee length), black shoes and stockings and a navy blue blazer, and cap with the school badge on it. The tall building next door was the boarding house.
